Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
`NOOB warning`
Hi, I'm trying to make a script an having trouble finding info on how to do it.  I don't know what search terms to use to find answers.
I have a `.txt` file of data I'd like to use.  I'm trying to figure out how to make a script that will use the data.
for example:
```komodo-cli -ac_name=${<COIN NAMES FROM .TXT>} getbalance```
so it will show results for all coins I add to .txt.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
cat txttile.txt | while read coins; do
        echo $coins
        komodo-cli -ac_name=$coins getbalance    
  done

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thank you üôè

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Just need a tally of counts, and maybe some way to see easily if the nodes chosen for bestmask are rotating properly.. I saw that it was starting at some node number, for the first vin in the tx, and slowly increasing this by 1 every round.... But the lower number nodes appeard to get more notaa. NOt enough sample size to know for sure though.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There is no banning happening atm. It is hard coded to just ban node 5. Which is turned off atm

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The ban works, but I think it was having trouble reaching consensus when a node was banned.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: May be enough to just detect bad sigs and just notify the OP.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Rather than banning..

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We just never had any easy way to detect bad sigs, its was a manul process that took hours for each tx, so I automated it inside iguana itself using some magic code from nSPV.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: making a node actually produce bad sigs wasnt as easy as I thaught it would be, so I just banned node 5 in the code lol
